Topic: Build production network and collect all data sources
Details: Revised Question: How do global commodity shocks transmit through India's production network to affect sectoral vulnerability, and how does trade exposure amplify these effects?

Topic: Download all FREE data sources (90 min total)
Download World Bank Pink Sheet commodity prices (oil wheat copper aluminum)
Download MOSPI Input-Output Tables (2015-16 139 sectors)
Download RBI macroeconomic data (IIP WPI GDP exchange rates)
Download IMF Direction of Trade Statistics (India aggregate bilateral trade)
Download OECD global indicators (GDP growth inflation)
Download NOAA climate indices (El Niño/La Niña for instruments)
Download OPEC production data (instruments for oil price)
Clean all datasets and prepare for analysis
Clean commodity prices: handle NaN remove outliers calculate log returns
Process MOSPI I-O tables: extract Use matrix Make matrix calculate technical coefficients
Clean RBI IIP data: monthly production indices for 8 core industries + manufacturing
Clean IMF DOTS data: India bilateral trade totals with 8 partners (USA CHN SAU ARE QAT DEU FRA ITA)
Create master time alignment: merge all datasets to monthly frequency (2010-2024)
Build data dictionary: document all 100+ variables with sources
Build 139-sector production network from I-O tables
Build sectoral production network: 139 sectors from I-O tables edges = input flows
Calculate Leontief inverse matrix: (I - A)^-1 for multiplier analysis
Calculate forward & backward linkages: identify key sectors
Identify energy-intensive sectors: flag sectors with >10% energy input share
Calculate production network topology: density clustering path lengths
Calculate centrality and trade exposure indices
Calculate centrality measures: degree betweenness closeness eigenvector PageRank
Details: For all 139 sectors in production network

Topic: Calculate commodity exposure indices: sector's commodity input intensity
Details: Energy exposure = energy inputs / total inputs

Topic: Calculate trade partner concentration: Herfindahl index from IMF DOTS
Details: HHI = sum of squared trade shares

Topic: Create network visualizations: hierarchical production network (upstream→downstream)
Sprint 1 deliverables: presentation + documentation
Establish causal pathways and create ML-ready features
Use OPEC quotas and weather shocks as instruments
Literature review: identify valid instruments (OPEC quotas weather shocks)
Details: Find 3-5 key papers on IV methods

Topic: Prepare IV framework: endogenous = commodity prices outcomes = sectoral IIP
Run first-stage regressions: OPEC quotas → oil prices check F-stat > 10
Run second-stage 2SLS: instrumented prices → sectoral output (IIP)
Test instrument validity: Sargan-Hansen J-test
Robustness checks: alternative instruments pre/post 2015 subsamples
Create IV results tables and coefficient plots
Analyze major commodity shock events
Define treatment events: 2008 crisis 2014 oil crash 2022 Ukraine war
Select donor pool: Brazil Indonesia Turkey Mexico South Africa
Collect predictor variables: GDP per capita trade openness commodity dependence
Construct synthetic India: optimize weights to match pre-treatment
Estimate treatment effects: actual India vs synthetic India post-shock
Conduct placebo tests: run SCM on all donors
Details: Check if India's effect is unusual

Topic: Create SCM visualizations: actual vs synthetic trajectories
Test temporal causation
Test stationarity: ADF tests on all time series
Determine optimal lag length: AIC/BIC criteria
Run Granger causality tests: commodity prices → sectoral IIP
Estimate VAR model: oil price IIP exchange rate
Generate impulse response functions: sector responses to commodity shock
Forecast error variance decomposition: % variance from commodity shocks
Check VAR stability: roots inside unit circle
Create IRF plots with 95% confidence bands
Create 150+ features for ML models
Extract network centrality features: degree betweenness closeness for 139 sectors
Create lagged commodity price features: 1 3 6 12-month lags
Create price volatility features: rolling 3 6 12-month standard deviations
Create shock indicators: binary variables for price changes > 2 SD
Create commodity exposure features: energy input share food input share
Create trade concentration features: HHI partner diversification
Create interaction features: centrality × commodity exposure
Create temporal features: month quarter year cyclical encodings
Merge all into master ML dataset: 150+ features
Reduce dimensionality and prepare train/test
Calculate correlation matrix: identify multicollinearity (|r| > 0.9)
Calculate VIF: drop features with VIF > 10
Run Random Forest for feature importance: rank top 50 features
Apply PCA if needed: retain 95% variance
Normalize features: standardize to mean=0 std=1
Create train-test split: 80% train (2010-2020) 20% test (2021-2024)
Sprint 2 deliverables: causal evidence summary + feature documentation
Build models run scenarios deliver project
Train time-series neural networks
Build naive baselines: moving average linear regression
Design LSTM architecture: 2-3 LSTM layers dropout dense output
Prepare sequential data: create 12-month sequences
Train LSTM model: Adam optimizer MSE loss early stopping
Hyperparameter tuning: grid search over units dropout
Train sector-specific LSTMs: 5 key sectors
Evaluate LSTM: calculate RMSE MAE MAPE on test set
Create learning curves: training vs validation loss
Train gradient boosting and ensemble
Train XGBoost model: use all 150+ features cross-validation
Hyperparameter tuning: max_depth learning_rate n_estimators
Extract feature importance: identify top 30 predictive features
Train Random Forest: additional baseline
Build ensemble model: stack LSTM + XGBoost with meta-learner
5-fold time series cross-validation: expanding window
Create model comparison table: all models × all metrics
Train GNN on production network
Install PyTorch Geometric: set up GNN environment
Convert production network to PyG format: node features + edge indices
Design GNN architecture: 2-3 GraphSAGE layers + global pooling
Prepare node features: sector characteristics from I-O table
Train GNN on production network: predict sectoral stress from graph
Evaluate GNN vs traditional models: test set comparison
Ablation study: GNN with vs without network features
Comprehensive evaluation and comparison
Create model comparison table: RMSE MAE MAPE R² for all models
Generate prediction plots: actual vs predicted for 5 sectors
Error analysis: identify when/where models fail
Statistical significance tests: Diebold-Mariano test
Create residual diagnostic plots
Policy analysis and vulnerability ranking

Historical scenario 2: Simulate 2014 oil price crash
Historical scenario 3: Simulate 2022 Ukraine war (multi-commodity)
Counterfactual: diversified energy imports (reduce Gulf 30%)
Policy intervention 1: Strategic petroleum reserve (buffer 10% shocks)
Policy intervention 2: Commodity hedging via futures

Identify top 10 vulnerable sectors
